name: Shauna Landers
text: Heath and his company of very professional employees built a detach garage with an apartment above it for my son, a deck for my husband, and a she shed lol for me, and a fence around my yard for our dogs. He was always on time and a man of his word. We highly recommend his company for any home improvements.

name: David Winters
text: First I am very particular of what things and a perfectionist. I just didn’t have the time to do all the work myself. I usually do everything myself. I received multiple estimates and Heath was the more affordable option, but not just price but his attention to detail while talked and looked at all the things I wanted done to my home. It’s a rather large home and the items to do were: new siding on the entire house, a few new windows, new gutters, stack stone and cedar posts on porch, exposed wood work in the eaves, and remove a rather large bay window and put an addition of 10’x10’ roughed in for a laundry room. First of all Heath and Crew knocked it out of the park. Being an older home they even tyvex wrapped the entire house, and found 1 rotted wall hiding behind the old siding. I received a FaceTime call from Heath showing me the damage and a quote to fix the wall the correct way and asked if I wanted it fixed. I agreed to let them fix it. There was awesome communication during the entire job. The day we met to sign the contract I paid a percentage for materials and was told to go down tot he building supply store to pick out the colors and a gigantic rear door and windows and they would be waiting on me. I went right down there and they already had a ticket waiting and items for the job placed on it with notes of things I needed to put my choices on. Back to being a perfectionist along the I looked at it everyday when I got home and anything that seem just right I would call Heath and we would talk about. When the work was going on was a couple years ago when it rained from Thanksgiving to spring about every day. Heath crew worked every minute it wasn’t raining and some things they could do out of the rain. Even though they had multiple crews and jobs going I still seen the owner of the company Heath at my house every morning the workers showed up giving out the plan for the day and a lot of those days Heath was with them tool belt on and hammer in hand working with them. The other companies was the owner giving quotes much higher so they could skate 20% off the top to do the job but never show up to work. I wasn’t about paying someone just to put their name sign in my yard but leave it up to the crew to do the work. I highly recommend Heath Davis Construction for any home needs you got. It may take a 1-2 weeks to get your estimate after meeting, but when you get it it is very detailed and not chicken scratch on a torn up piece of notebook paper! You have to watch paying attention to a lot of negative reviews because, 1.) disgruntled employees that do things to get fired are “always” innocent LoL, and 2.) some people you can never make happy no matter what you do for them! A lot of people in our area has had work done by Heath and word of mouth is what made me call him. Also, rule of thumb is don’t ask one contractor about another because because the one you’re talking to wants your job.

name: Candace Smith
text: Done a great quick job for me. Very highly recommended. Nice respectful man to work with. The post Candace Smith is my other account that got hacked. Had to make a new one. Obviously wrong review.

name: Candace Smith
text:
Edit to add: no my account was not hacked, they just changed the name to make it look like it was me, which is disgusting. Just another example of how shady he actually is.

Heath Davis is rude and unprofessional. I would not recommend him for any work and he will certainly never have my business in the future.

If you’ve started a home renovation project you cannot complete (no matter the reason), be prepared to be shamed and ridiculed for DARING to ask this outstandingly rude business owner to quote you.

name: Silas Brown
text: Poor quality of craftsmanship and overall lacking in service.  I would never recommend this business.  If it was possible to give 0 stars I would.

name: Jason B
text: I can not say anything about their work because they never showed up to our scheduled appointment for an estimate. I called and left a message and they did not return my call. I waited for three days and called them again and when they answered it seemed like they couldn't hear me and then they hung up on me. I can understand that, it could have been a bad connection but then I called back twice and it automatically went straight to voice mail. This is not how you do business and treat potential customers. I wouldn't waste your time with these people.

name: Bama3636
text: Heath Davis was the contractor who performed some renovations on a home I purchased. The entire process was a nightmare from the start. To begin you can hardly get ahold of him to answer any questions, the crews seem to show up when they feel like it, and the quality of work was terrible. The part that really bothered me the most was how almost all material used seemed to be some 2nd hand material he picked up that was on clearance. The doors installed were not the doors agreed upon, carpet was supposed to be the same throughout the carpeted areas but every room was different, and the handrails in the house were an outside metal handrail instead of an interior decor. I would never recommend this company for any work!

name: Michael Woods
text:
Stay very far away from this company! Heath is not to be trusted and never take him for his word. First of all Heath came out to do an estimate on a few projects. He told me he has so many people they would line up and knock the work out in 2 days. This would be the start of many lies!

The day they were supposed to start no one showed or called. I called the office and talked to Misty. She told me they are running a few days behind and that I was next in line. She was right, about a week later some guys were here to roof the small building I had. That’s about the only time Heath and his guys showed up on time. For the next 10 weeks all we heard was excuse after excuse why no one was there. Heath actually sent me a nasty email trying to tell me that I didn’t know what was going on.

Let’s start with the windows. Heath replaced 3 windows. The first and biggest window I actually had to help the guy install because Heath dropped him off by himself. The windows are very cheap and took 10 weeks to install and finish out.

Next is the new interior door he installed. Heath bought the wrong door and instead of taking it back and getting the correct door he tried to customize it. This consisted of adding a block of wood to the jam. Looks absolutely horrible! The door hit on the bottom and is hard to close. My sisters kid could have done a better job.

Now for the thing he called a deck. There are somewhere around 30-40 nails that are sticking out to where it can cut you or rip your clothes. Heath was supposed to drill into the concrete and anchor the deck boards down but he did not. A 19x15 deck only had 4 sets of nails in each board. It bounces and creaks everywhere. Definitely now square. One side measures 19’ the other side is 19’11”. The over hang of the deck boards go from 2” to 6” and looks like a drunk man tried to cut a straight line.

Overall I would recommend this ragtag company to change out a roll of toilet paper. Biggest mistake of my life was to hire Heath. Very dishonest and doesn’t care about the customer.

name: Griffin Mccurry
text: not a whole lot more you could ask for, showed up when he said, did the work he was supposed to do, charge agreed upon price, easy to deal with, I for sure will be calling him again. - Wes McCurry

name: Silas Brown
text: horrible... not a man of his word be careful before doing business with this person... very toxic.... do your homework and choose a different contractor...

name: thomas dunnavant
text: Heath installed a lot of gutters systems for me when i was building homes...and i still recommend his services to clients who need gutters and home repairs.  He paints, does renovation, and roofing and gutters

name: Michel Hamann
text: Can't get call back for work. Won't answer phone.

name: Chad Martin
text: These guys are easy to work with and deliver superb results. Great builders who believe in getting the work right and seeing smiles on their client's faces

name: Sabrina Batchelor
text: Just beautiful 😍💓

name: Jessica Gibson
text: Do not waste your time or money. Professional up front. Quick estimate that turned into a drawn out month and a half for a slab to be poured for a 30x35 metal building. Drug the whole process out until pouring the concrete, which they rushed. There were holes, it was flaky and rough, when we asked for smooth, and then took 2 days to do patchwork, resulting in more flaking like a powdery floor I can poke my finger through. As soon as this was done, the owner called saying he was in a bind and that he knew it looked bad, but it was structurally sound and he needed his money. He went on to say that he would be unable to complete the ramps and the driveway repair that was initially agreed upon and in the estimate. He never calls unless you call first and sweetly lies about the progress and timeline. Worst experience every and will try and keep anyone else from going through the same thing if possible.

name: Del Chick
text: Jessica is absolutely right, he promises a good job, just about guarantees it verbally.    After waiting nine months For someone to come back and repair the imperfections in the concrete job they did on our patio, we were able to negotiate a different type of compensation.   Sometimes with contractors that’s what you have to do, it’s too bad, but that’s part of working with contractors.

name: Melissa Grodi
text: Ken Nummy and his crew were very professional and they did an amazing job replacing 2 large retaining walls and pouring a driveway on our property. The price was very reasonable and, since they were already on thevproperty, the crew helped my husband do all sorts of odds and ends at no additioal charge. I highly recommend K.C. Nummy.

name: Ankh rafiel Ali
text: They do good work

name: Carolyn Freeman
text: On August 22nd 2018 my home suffered massive water damage due to broken water pipes.  State Farm agent/adjuster hired Landmark Construction to make the repairs. Art Kuntzman, owner of Landmark Construction, evaluated the damage and assembled a team to start the repairs. A team of approximately 10 workers worked for several weeks then they stopped all repairs. At this time I discovered they had stolen thousands of dollars in personal items. This has been a nightmare trying to get Landmark Construction to make good on the repairs and recovery of stolen items, having to fill police reports, as well as filling claims with State Farm insurance.

resp.text: We have turned this over to our attorney and will be suing for libel.

name: George Adams
text: One of my tenets started a small kitchen fire by accident but decided not to let us know until they moved out. Helped make a bad situation better by repairing the fire damage and thankfully getting rid of the smoke smell.

name: Eric Echols
text: Was unable to help me or give me a quote. Interior and exterior was looked at and I was hopeful. Even if insurance didn't cover it, we knew it had to be repaired. The person that did the initial visit was professional. Disappointed I could not get help with the matter or receive a quote. If they could not fix or repair it, a referral would have been nice.

resp.text: I inspected the roof damage and interior water damage on the fireplace wall for Mr. Echols.  Mr. Echols also had me look at the back side of the house where there was rotten siding that covered the entire rear elevation. I had my roofer go by and do an inspection on the roof and he identified that the existing top layer of roofing also had a roll roof installed under the top layer of roofing indicating that a repair has been attempted in the past already on this issue and considering the complexity of the repair and how extensive it would be to repair the water leak completely and with a warranty,  I then contacted Mr. Echols with the information. Mr. Echols informed me that replacing the entire front slope (which is what was required in order to perform this task correctly where a warranty could come with the work) he informed me that it would be to much for him to do. I informed Mr. Echols that a simple repair could not be done and also explained to him that Landmark does not like to get into performing repairs behind other trades that had already failed the first time. Mr. Echols then said that he would go elsewhere for another Estimate. -David

name: Nicholas Franklin
text: My basement flooded and I actually didn’t catch it immediately so mold started growing everywhere. It smelled awful. I called Landmark Construction because I’ve heard some good things about them from other families in Memphis and I can honestly say that if they hadn’t been there so quickly things may have been a lot worse. Their water damage restoration services dried up my basement and got rid of the mold. 10/10 would recommend should you ever have an emergency like I did.

resp.text: Thanks for the review Nicholas. Our water mitigation team doesn't miss a beat and are the quickest in town. We appreciate you calling us.

Their estimator is supposed to come out tomorrow to determine my insurance claim amount. Once that happens, Landmark will replace the floors. They’re also going to give me an estimate to do the floors in other areas of the house.

Landmark has made this whole process very easy. I love that they have people who can handle a wide array of issues. Every single person that has come to my house has been polite and professional. They have done a great job at communicating expectations. They show up when they say they will, and really seem to care about doing a great job and making their customers happy.

I won’t call another company ever again. Landmark will handle all my home repairs from now on. They are the best!

text: The Landmark emergency service crew was fantastic. Great customer service and friendly attitude. I would recommend this crew to anyone in need. Kudos to Delbert and team. He explained every step of the process. Thank you!

name: Heather Huffman
text: Landmark to the rescue once again!!  One of the most courteous, prompt, trustworthy and knowledgeable companies I've ever worked with. Unfortunately, I have had to use their services three times in a year, and each time I'm amazed at how efficient they are. The most recent issue was flooding in my house. I called and someone was here in a timely manner- they quickly went to work and finished within a few days. I highly recommend Landmark if you ever need help.

resp.text: Thanks Heather for the great review and  continuing to trust Landmark construction emergency services with your emergency needs

name: hollye vann
text: Very upset with this place. with repairs on roof. 2 different times. My insurance referred them and now were having to pay for it now. They might be good with other things but roofing is a negative.I was told after fixing a area that leaked again and charged that they have to make some money. We learned our lesson the hard way.

name: Jess Palmer
text:
This company takes the phrase "cutting corners" to new, literal levels. If you get nothing else from my review, get this: use anyone but Landmark.

This company dragged my relatively small project on for months. The employees are nice enough, but are unbelievably slow and inept. More than once, I had to call the main office to "tattle" on Ben, the project manager, who had gone totally AWOL and would not communicate despite my house being in complete disarray thanks to his project management.

Installing quarter round proved too difficult for this company. They had to come out over 4 separate times to complete this job. They literally skipped parts of the wall because there was furniture or a floor mat in front of it. They skipped the kitchen entirely. And when they did return to install it there, they literally just left giant gaps in each corner without joining the pieces together. They were dumbfounded that I wanted the quarter round to join at the corners. WTF!

They destroyed 2 toilet lids by putting tools on them.  They re-seated toilets crooked and rocking and leaking.  They left the closet bolts uncovered and did a caulking job you'd expect from a toddler.

There are places in the laminate floor with visible gaps between planks. There were gouges in it that they filled with wood filler and called it a day. They did a sloppy paint job in both bathrooms (at least they got the color right, though).

It was unbelievable how many times these people had to come back to my house to fix their screw-ups and even now, a year later, I'm still finding fresh, mind-boggling issues.

If you care about your house at all, use someone else.

I would like to add that the owner of the company did reach out to me within 24 hours of my review with apologies and an offer to make it right. I declined, however, on the basis that I have no faith in them being capable of doing any of this job.

resp.text:
Thank you for taking the time to communicate to us why our service did not meet your expectations. Please accept our sincerest apologies for any trouble or inconvenience we have caused you. We have every desire to address your needs and provide the best solution available to resolve your issues as soon as possible. Unfortunately, during our phone conversation on May 30, 2019, you informed us that you would not allow us the opportunity to resolve your issues.
In the event that you allow us to make matters right, please contact us at our office number (901-452-0390).

name: Lauren Russell
text: The Landmark Water mitigation crew saved us this week! Following a sizable water leak, the ceiling in our living room collapsed. I immediately called our Landmark contractor, who immediately dispatched the mitigation crew. Our ceiling collapsed at 5:30 and the crew was onsite within 35 minutes. They worked efficiently, moving our furniture and cleaning up the mountains of insulation. Jacob (the team leader) and the rest of his crew was top notch. They were kind and so easy to work with. In the following days, as Jacob monitored the drying, when he said he would be at my house at a certain time—- he showed up right when he promised. No four hour window of waiting which was so nice! The communication was above expectation and these guys made a less than desirable situation tolerable. I’m so thankful for Landmark, the water mitigation crew, our contractor, and Jacob!

resp.text: Thank you Lauren for the outstanding review and trusting Landmark in your time of need. It was a pleasure working with you and James.

name: Tyler Matz
text: I came home to a busted pipe in my basement and Jacob arrived that night with his team to extract the water and dry the walls and furniture to minimize the damage as much as possible. He was very professional and great at communication throughout the entire process. I would highly recommend this company!

resp.text: Thank you Tyler for the great review and choosing Landmark Construction & Emergency Services with your emergence.

name: Dwana McGuire
text: Delbert Palmer and his crew from Landmark Construction Company gave superior service and they were extremely helpful through a traumatic experience. Delbert was knowledgeable and provided me with a detailed explanation of the services that were being rendered. He went over and beyond the call of duty. While extracting the water from my flooded bathroom, he also assisted me with turning my water back on, changed the lightbulb in the flooded bathroom, and fixed the storm door. I highly recommend Landmark Construction Company for their prompt response, their effective and efficient service, and professionalism. The personal touch offered really helped me through a very difficult time.

resp.text: Thank you Dwana for the great review and trusting Landmark Construction & Emergency Services in your time of need.

text: If I could have reviewed at a zero star I would have. These people! They arrived late. We had called to have electrical wiring fixed from a fire under my uncle's house. They came out. They did absolutely nothing. Said they couldn't do anything until plumbing did their part which was fine. But why didn't they just charge me a service call? Instead they charged me a 150.00 for nothing. They were very sketchy. I wrote a check for the services. Them some women comes to the door asking me to re-wrote the check to a personal person because they couldn't cash it. Then when I asked for a receipt they said we don't have receipts today. Then when I thought ok something is not right here and called the office which was the dad he was in shock they asked for another check and had been told he didn't do anything....like I had not paid. Then he said let me see what is going on and I will call you back. He never calls back. The lady that I am pretty sure was on meth calls me back and says I won't charge when we come back. Well later that night my uncle has no hot water. They never turned the water heater back on. So that was a 125.00 extra charge from the plumber. It has been a total mess. DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY! RUN!

name: Beverly Welch
text: These are the worse electricians I have ever in countered.  They  started a job and did not finish. I had to call another electrician to redo all the work I thought MeLeod had completed.  I recommend you do not call these people not even to change a light bulb.

name: Craig Waldron
text: Don't use these people. I just left a job site where they left un-taped un-caped wires stuffed under the house. This is three feet from the house meter. Could not believe what I saw. How can these people be licensed. Need a 0 rating.

name: David Plokhooy
text: Under no circumstances should you consider using this company.  I contacted them to rewire a switch controlling one light and a ceiling fan (the light switch was working already but the ceiling fan was not).  They arrived two hours late, took out the old switch and could not figure out how to reinstall it.  In the process they disconnected several lines causing various lights, vents, fans, etc., throughout the home to quit working.  After three hours they quit, leaving hot electrical wires hanging out of the wall.  They returned the next day (three hours later than they agreed to arrive) and spent the entire day working on the wiring trying to determine why they had broken the circuit to the other locations.  After eight hours they "finished" and left -- with the switch they originally came to repair still not working.  After calling them the next day they sent another person who worked on the wiring and finally got the original switch working and the other outlets they had disconnected working but still did not ever get the ceiling fan working.  They then presented a bill for $85 for the original service call and $375 for the repair work they had to do to solve the other problems they created, and, the ceiling fan switch still does not work. $460 total for them to actually do nothing.  The switch that was working is still working, the circuits that were working before they disconnected them are still working as they were before McLeod arrived, and the ceiling fan still does not work.  I now have to hire someone else to perform the one task they were supposed to do.  Clueless, unprofessional, undependable and absolutely a waste of time and money.  Run away from these guys.

name: Courtney Fitchard
text: I am the owner of a company that has multiple cleaning services. Our company was called to service your facility a couple of days ago. The young lady Lydia, who was the POC for the company loved our services, so we sent a "Review Us" app to her phone. As fate would have it, my Operations Manager handed me the phone to give her further instructions on how to leave this review. To my surprise, the app was not working, and as a business owner I know how important reviews are especially a positive review for a small business such as mine that has to competes with larger ones.  Anyway, Ms. Lydia wasn't going to give up. In all of those frustrating moments, she kept a pleasant and professional    demeanor. Matter- of-fact, she was so delightful I wanted to leave a Google review on her, and to let you know that she adds value to your company.  I expect my employees to give great customer service, such as she gave to me. Please let her know that I appreciated her kindness.

name: Jim Dunning
text: The best fire alarm contractor

text: Friendly staff - was very helpful in selecting the building.

text: This is a very great place my husband works for them and the owner is a very fair and good man. He cares about the people that he has in his company and he cares about his community. His compassion for everyone else shows the kind of businessman that he must be. I would recommend this company not just for someone to work there but for a business that needs there work. Because they care about doing a good job and saving your company and providing excellent professionalism but providing the most fair and best job hands down.

name: Sarah Dunn
text:
I contacted Vance about some exterior maintenance and the larger job of painting my interior and making my home more handicapped-accessible for my mother. The work has been fast and of excellent quality, and we have enjoyed having Juan in our home and appreciate that he cleaned up so well when he was finished.

Additionally, Vance was able to recommend many alternatives to lower cost, as well as special touches that would make my mother even more mobile around the house.

We asked for a very special project for our back stairs that included a removable wheelchair ramp. We wanted to keep the originals stairs intact, and make sure that they had their own matching railings. Mike the welder did a beautiful job fulfilling our request, and now we have a ramp that can be removed, leaving the stairs intact.

We are extremely pleased, and I will definitely hire B&B again!

name: Steve Morgan
text: B&B did a major project for me and I could not be more pleased.  They communicated extremely well throughout the process and delivered the finished product that I was looking for.   They absolutely exceeded my expectations from start to finish.  The craftsmanship, quality, service and price were phenomenal and they were a joy to work with.  I highly recommend Vance Ballard and his team at B&B Construction.

name: Allen Stewart
text:
B&B did a basement remodel in my house, they were fast, always on time, easy to get in touch with and the price was unbeatable. They did an outstanding job and kept the area as clean as possible. The best part was they would show up with everything they needed to work on that day so there was no time wasted running back out.
They added so much to the overall value of my house.
Looking forward to getting them back out to do a few more projects for me.

name: Shay Morgan
text: We hired B & B Construction because we needed a professional, experienced contractor  to build our custom patio.  Vance and his crew were great!  They cut no corners!  The quality of materials they used and the craftsmanship of their work was impeccable.  We couldn’t be more pleased!

name: Matthew Norman
text: These guys were the most professional outfit I've encountered in Birmingham and I've tried a lot of them. Their work was far superior to other contractors I've used, they were timely and knew how to meet a budget and deadlines! Hands down... Rock stars. Would gladly use them again!

name: John Michael Lee
text: AMAZING BUSINESS!! Wouldn’t work with anyone else!

name: Allen & Emily Stewart
text: I have used award winning B&B Construction for years for all of my home remodels and additions. Vance is a genius, and the most hard working person I’ve ever known. Anytime we need something done, 7 days a week, he answers. His bids are always more than fair and he only uses quality grade products. New construction, remodel, addition, what ever you need, they are definitely the best.

name: Justin Bernard
text: Not a good look when you try and leave a message after someone clearly ignored the call and your voicemail is full..

resp.text:
Justin,

I apologize if I missed your call. I try very hard to be responsive to all calls. I was most likely with another client or on a job site in a situation where I could not answer. Scaffolds, concrete, skill saws, and cell phone usage doesn’t mix. I also receive a high volume of calls each week and apologize if my voicemail was full. I would love to speak to you if you still need help with your project. Feel free to call and text me your information. Sometimes that’s the best way to get me.

name: Brandon Jackson
text: Our realtor referred Vance Ballard and B&B Construction to us to perform repairs on our back porch. B&B performed the work for a reasonable and fair price. B&B did an excellent job and performed all work we requested with exceptional skill and in a timely manner. We will be using Vance and B&B again in the future.

name: Taylor George
text: Took great care of us. Thanks again!

name: Shaun Mazur
text: I needed some paver work done at the house and Vance was quick to come out to give a quote and timeline of project. I couldnt have asked for a more professional, timely, and standup job than what B&B provided. I will definitely use this company again. Keep up the great work!

name: Daniel Steel
text: Great people, went way out of their way to try and help me with my moms estate.

name: Prashant Patel
text: Very professional and work done in a timely manner! Highly recommend

name: Ellen Keith
text: Highly recommend B &B!  They were professional, on time, high quality and on budget!  I will certainly call again when needed  😃

name: Claudia Bugna
text: If you ever hire this company I encourage you to get a written contract on deliverables....

resp.text:
Mrs. Bugna, it’s laughable that you’d post this considering how badly you got embarrassed yesterday in Birmingham Circuit Court but thank you for opening the door for me to expose the truth.

Two years ago, you and your husband frivolously sued B&B and filed a complaint with the Alabama Home Builder’s Board against B&B, costing me thousands in attorney fees to defend myself and more importantly, wasting huge amounts of my time.

Honestly, it weighed heavily on me and stressed me out because the claim was so ridiculous. You sued me for $40,000. The whole suit was completely baseless but nonetheless, it had to be defended gobbling up large amounts of time/money.

Here are the results after 8+ hours in the courtroom yesterday.  You nor your husband could keep your lies straight and got totally embarrassed on stand.

B&B was found completely innocent on all charges.

The judge awarded you ZERO $0.00 of the $40,000 you sued for.

Additionally, the Alabama Home Builders Licensee Board found me innocent of all 6 charges and now this case is attached to the complaint you filed with the state board,  which completely puts it to bed.

The judge basically threatened to put your husband, Adrian Bugna, in jail for perjury because he caught you both in so many lies.

Then, the judge awarded me the full value of my counterclaim for $16,000 and then scolded you from the bench for making false claims.

You were both exposed for lying and for trying to get money you didn’t deserve and after you get humiliated in court,  you go online and give B&B a bad review on Google, which is petty and quite frankly, it is shameful.

name: Joe Ragsdale
text: Amazing company! True professionals that do incredible work!

name: Savannah Fielding
text: horrible service sums it all...

resp.text: Savannah, B&B has never worked for you nor have I ever talked to you so I am not sure how we provided horrible service. There are several companies with the name B&B, possibly you have the wrong company here.

name: Florence Stewart
text: I did call and spoke to one of the owners of this company.  I requested an estimate for a roof rebuild.  I was asked if I would be using an insurance company and I said no.  I explained that I settled with the insurance company for a payment minus the deductible.  He asked me to send pictures of the damaged house.  Which I sent the same day.  On that same day I texted him asking when he would be able to come out to give me an estimate.  To this day I have not heard one word from this company.  Therefore the only evaluation I can give is that I talked to this company and was given the impression that I would get an estimate but they have not followed through.  If I do hear from B&B Construction Company at anytime in the future I will update my review.

resp.text:
Hello Florence,
I am the owner of the company and unfortunately, I do not recall this correspondence but I do apologize for your experience.  There are multiple B&B's in Birmingham,  and I have countless times taken their calls and probably vice versa so possibly this wasn't even us but if it was, I take full responsibility.  I don't check my google reviews that often so I regret letting this bad review sit unanswered for this long.  My crews and I work 7 days a week and have great reviews from everyone we have actually worked for so it's hurtful to have someone slam  my company when we've never even met, never worked for you, and to my knowledge never spoken.  We are a small & local company that strives to be local, buy local, and stay local.  Ironically, I built B&B with the mindset that I never wanted to get to0 big to not answer my own calls or be unavailable to customers.  With that goal in mind, I have limits.  In an industry of deadlines and high pressure, it is possible that I was busy and did not get back with you about your inquiry and again, if this was the right B&B, I appologize.  I see that you have reviewed 164 companies.
B&B was awarded the Birmingham Revitalization Award for our work, and I was selected as one of Birmingham's Best Builders.  If we ever work for you, I think you'll change your mind about B&B.

name: Tyler Strauss
text: Had an amazing experience with B&B. Vance helped me from start to finish with my project and couldn’t have done a better job. They take the cake with every category: professionalism, punctuality, quality and communication. Thank you B&B!

name: Shanice Marie
text: I recently met the owner, such a kind hearted man. I would definitely do business with him. He cares about the clients and is proud of his work!

name: Jeff Green
text: I followed B and B’s work on Facebook prior to using them. I can honestly say that their quality and craftsmanship are unmatched here in the Birmingham area. You will NOT be disappointed! Vance’s attention to detail made my wife extremely happy. I highly recommend this company.

name: Christopher Samford
text: B&B is the best thing I have ever come across. I have worked with so many “handy men” that were unreliable and never showed up on time to fix anything.  B&B can fix or repair anything!! After my initial contact I had a crew at my house in less than an hour on a weekend. Such professional gentlemen had my door replaced in two hours. I am shocked by the efficiency and price. I would and will recommend B&B Construction to everyone!!

name: robin guion
text:
We had a multi level deck built , flower beds rebuilt, fencing repaired,  entire roof replaced,  interior wall replaced, restoration of back and front entrances to our home: bay window repair, electrical lighting  work done:
The work was started when promised and finished early !!
Working with Vance Ballard by far  has  out shined  and with great quality any other work we have ever had completed on our house:
Vance was easy to contact , easy to communicate with  and did not hesitate to change or alter anything I may have been concerned about during the process:
In addition his crew was superior- polite , clean, always smiling and respecting our home:  I returned home from work late one night( 10 PM) and found 2 of Vance's crew members helping my husband fix a major water leak in our side yard( nothing to do with their work)  they made several trips to home depot and worked by flashlight: corrected the problem-refused to take money- just plain good people!!
we have a second list of changes to our home and there is no question we will return to Vance Ballard  B&B  Construction.
chris and robin guion  mountain brook

name: Sarah Hyche
text: B&B Construction has completed several projects for me over the last year. When I first purchased my home in Mountain Brook/Crestline, they repaired all my sheetrock, added crown moulding, and painted the entire interior of my home and performed a complete tear off on my roof and repaired the decking and put on new shingles. I was so happy with their work! They actually finished on time and on budget and left my home and my yard extremely clean. I was so pleased that I hired them again last month to renovate my kitchen and my foyer.  They finished in 4 days, and I just love to sit and stare at the completed work! I highly recommend B&B! They are polite, clean, courteous, and very detail oriented. I will definitely use them again for my next project!

name: Alabama Home Pure
text: Poor communication is horrible business practices! I tried getting them to call and schedule a time to give me a quote for close to 3 months. At first I couldn’t get a response even with emailing, texting and leaving voicemails. Any time they would actually respond to me they were out of town. I finally sent them a text and said that I didn’t want to continue to bother them that if they were interested to let me know..... and of course still haven’t received a response. Guess I’m glad I figured their lack of communication skills before they did work on my house! How are customers suppose to communicate a issue if you don’t respond. One source ended up doing our project I would highly recommend them verses these guys.

resp.text: First of all, I want to extend my sincerest apologies if I neglected to respond to your inquires. I also do not recall ever speaking to you to tell you that I was not available or out of town. I pride myself on being a small local business, and I truly make it a point to be receptive to calls, and I give out my personal cell phone so that I can make myself available.  I am glad that you were able to find a contractor to complete your project; however, I do once again apologize that you were not able to get in touch with me.

name: Mario Gabriel JR.
text: To begin this review I must state I am a very demanding person when it comes to details. An absolute great experience having our covered back porch screened in by Custom Sunrooms and Siding at a very reasonable price. Andrew handled all the admin details from the initial call to the signing of the contract with job requirements. Gary did all the work and did so efficiently and very cleanly; totally professional. Because we have an annoying frog population, we requested every opening, every gap, to be closed which they did. And then they color match caulked every point to ensure full enclosure. All done in 2 1/2 days. Not an excessive timeline considering the extremely high roof and intricate design of the rustic wood roof. My neighbors have had nothing but praise for the looks. We are extremely satisfied. A local business certainly worth supporting.

name: Matt Wilkenson
text: I highly recommend this company to anyone considering a sunroom. From the day of the estimate to the day of completion, Andrew always kept an open line of communication and provided any updates that he had. Shane was a perfectionist when it came to installation - He went above and beyond to make sure everything was how it should be and the end result was exceptional. You will not find a more professional group of people - If you're searching for companies for your project, stop now, because these are the guys you want.

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-star review and recommendation, Matt. We're happy to know we were able to help every step of the way from estimate to installation. If you need anything else, please don't hesitate to reach out!

text: We had a wonderful experience. Knowledgeable staff and quality product. Our screen porch is our favorite room in the house! I would highly recommend using Custom Sunrooms.

resp.text: Emily, thank you for the glowing review. It's so great to hear that your new screened-in porch is your favorite room in your home! We appreciate the recommendation and are so glad to hear your experience was a great one.

text: We are contracted with Custom Sunrooms to replace a sunroom roof. They have yet to begin work because of lead times, but judging by their knowledgeable approach to pricing etc. I am sure they will do an excellent job!

resp.text: Joe, thank you for the 5-stars! We are looking forward to working with you soon, we are sure you will be satisfied with the work we do on your roof.

name: Robert Bois
text: I looked at 5 different companies to construct for me a screen room on my back patio. And I must say I struck gold when I signed on with Custom Sunrooms & Siding. The biggest discriminator for me to go with this company at time of sale was the abject honesty and no BS approach by Mr. Dennis Crutchfield. He was also very helpful in helping me wade through a myriad of options decisions, all with no pressure. There was no question when I agreed to his offer that I was getting the best value for money. And how right I was. My room was constructed by Mr. Gary and he has literally years of experience building these things. Without question he is a master craftsman and the end product we got is far better than any of my neighbors' screen rooms that I have seen (and many of them I may add). My new screen room is simply the best constructed that I have seen. I wish I could rate this company with Six Stars!  Thank you Custom Sunrooms & Siding, I could not be any happier with our new screen room!

name: Shanna B
text: I couldn't be more pleased with the work done on my sun room. They were super friendly, and it was completed in one day. I highly recommend these wonderful guys.

name: Norman Rickell
text: If possible I would give Andrew, his father Dennis and their awesome installer Shane 10 stars !!  They gave the first estimate for our project and we did get several more. We even visited several showrooms and compared products. Nobody we found builds a quality product like these guys. Shane endeared himself into our hearts and that of our lab, Lizzie .. he became like family. He is so meticulous in his work and stops at nothing to do everything right the first time.  Our screen patio is structurally extremely sturdy and completely leak free even in the worst of our downpours and it looks fabulous and adds so much curb appeal to our home. I can not say enough good stuff about this company and its people other than they are totally awesome and in my opinion build an extremely high quality product. Other companies were going to charge extra for several things that were included in our bid. They were not the cheapest bid for our project but we did get everything we paid for and then some. Believe me, you will not be disappointed with the quality of their workmanship, their expert workmanship nor their overall service.  I highly recommend that you give them a call and let the magic happen !!!

text: Had a problem  after a storm and they came out and fixed it in a couple of days. Great work and service, nice folks and stands behind there work!!

text: We had two sunrooms added on to our house....the difference is amazing...added more value to our home and also curb appeal!  Service and installation was the best.  Crews cleaned up every day when they were done and service was prompt and courteous!  Couldn't be happier!

text: Had screen and sides added to back of house porch years ago. Excellent workmanship and we enjoy it every day. Great company as when granddaughter stabbed a hole in one screen they  came to Mobile and repaired for a nominal charge. Will use them again and highly recommend them.

text: Excellent rating earned for sure! From start... when calling for estimate and information, the person answering was professional, friendly and concise....to meeting with dedicated, knowledgeable Andrew who arrived at precise appointment time given me...to the construction of 2 over door coverings, work people, materials used, (even delivery of) and extreme timely completion. All were of integrity and quality, including the actual coverings. I met with, and obtained 2 other estimates prior to Custom Sunrooms and Siding....no comparison. Totally, without reservation recommend these folks. And, if there is a change...."no problem". I should have extended a covering by a couple feet, and would like to add deck/steps....assured by both the worker team and Andrew....can do at any time. They truly are committed to customer satisfaction and ease. Through all the recent rains, have not had one issue or reason to call. The work was done properly and accurately at time of construction. The price quoted on contract was it. No added on extras or deviation. Thank You!

name: Jamey S
text:
In my experience, Mr Jarmin is prone to ignore the punch list on homes he has built, particularly if the customer is a single mom with too much on her plate to harass him enough to get the job done. He will just ignore you until the home warranty expires and you’ve lost the energy to make him do what you paid him $200,000 to do. Now that the home is for sale, the things he never took care of affect the sale value, and he doesn’t have the integrity to do his job and honor his obligations to his customer.

His response to calls inquiring about a termite bond, and other useful information is to yell at you through the phone, “Don’t you call me again about this house!!!!” He sure as heck isn’t going to fix the acrylic his subs tore up the day they installed the shower, or anything else listed on the inspection “to be repaired” before closing. He makes it clear once a check is cut he has no more interest in his customer or his workmanship (or lack thereof). He will just ignore you, or yell at you if you make the mistake of assuming he has enough integrity to do his job and call him.

I would never recommend anyone use him. I will certainly never make the mistake again myself. There are many builders with integrity who value their customers and the reputation of their product in Tuscaloosa. I would never include Rick Jarman in that list.

Of course, if you want someone to look you in the eye and lie to you at closing that he will fix all the problems with his house he is selling you, RJ is your man!!

text: Incredible installation of crawlspace encapsulation, however our factory new sump pump had a faulty switch. Aqua-Guard responded the next day and replaced the entire pump. I never write reviews but felt i should for these guys. They really helped us out with our flood water issues.

name: Brook Armistead
text: We had them scheduled for our waterproofing and we had a contractor come in and do the demolition in our main bathroom. We tried to contact them multiple times over the course of two weeks and never got a response. By the time we finally heard back from them it was the day before our scheduled appointment to have them come in and do the waterproofing and they said there was more our contractor needed to do. They had to push out our date and put us at the back of the line even though they are the ones that did not respond to our multiple calls. Therefore we have decided to go with Bdry instead. Mike NEVER returned our calls once he sold the job!!

resp.text: We respectfully disagree with this complaint.  I met with Mr. Patel (I have never met Brook Armistead and she was not present) on 4-9-2021 to provide him with a quote (approximately 8 weeks prior to installation date).  It is my understanding that Brook Armistead is Mr. Patel's wife.  At that time, I went over in detail what prep work would need to be done in order for us to install our waterproofing system.  I informed Mr. Patel that I would be glad to provide him with a contractor that could do the prep work properly, he chose to use his own contractor.  Mr. Patel and I had several conversations leading up to the date of the installation about specifics of the job.  The statement that I never returned phone calls is patently false.  Mr. Patel has had several conversations with our office as well, to which his phone calls were always answered or returned (records to prove it).  Our office called to confirm the installation date on June 3rd, at which time Tina went over everything that needed to be moved again.  I spoke with Mr. Patel on Monday, June 7, TWO days prior to installation date of June 9. It was at this time I discovered Mr. Patel had been misinformed by his contractor about what needed and didn't need to be removed.  Aqua-Guard only removed Mr. Patel from the schedule when he wanted us to postpone his job.  In that conversation our office manager explained to him that if he postponed the job that we are booked out and couldn't guarantee when he could be worked back into the schedule.  He called us back on June 10 to get back on the schedule and we were unable to give him an immediate schedule date. We were in the process of shuffling our schedule to work him back in when Mr. Patel called our office today upset and cancelled the project all together.  We were not going to put him at the back of the line.  We regret the homeowner feels this way but we feel we did everything we could to accommodate them.

name: Laine White
text: Emmanuel was so wonderful and we had the best experience with him! It’s so hard to find people who are wonderful to work with these days, and he helped us with our water issue and was a pleasure to do business with. Cant recommend him enough!

name: Kreg Newman
text: They did a phenomenal job waterproofing my basement.  The employees were all courteous, professional and on time.  The work was perfect and is functioning as advertised.  Would absolutely recommend them!

name: Dylan Scroggins
text: I think I earned a Masters degree in encapsulation/water-proofing due to all the research I put into the job I needed and who to go with. After having AquaGuard complete our crawlspace I can assure you that they are the best in the business. I was VERY impressed with the professionalism and quality of their work from every member of their team. From the front office to the front lines they are good people that do great work. Highly suggest!

name: Mick McGrath
text: They were very accommodating,  and do great work!

name: Jill Rogers
text:
2nd Update -
AquaGuard returned to make repairs as needed and did an excellent job. They were very apologetic for the issues we experienced and did everything they could to make up for it. Because of this, I cannot recommend them enough, they were extremely professional and handled the situation with ease. They came out immediately to fix the issues and I wouldn't hesitate to hire them again if we ever need to. Very grateful to Manny and Tina for their help!

They installed a sump pump and an excellent waterproofing system in our basement for the previous owners who lived here. We contacted AquaGuard to redirect one of the discharge lines and they quoted us a reasonable price, so we decided to have them do it. It took several calls to get them to come out, and they finally came out about 4 months later. The guys who did the work didn’t cap the sewage line, so I called them and asked if they could come back as it should only take a few minutes. Well I wasn’t surprised when they didn’t so I just went to Home Depot and purchased what I needed. Overall, quality of work was good (besides not capping the sewage pipe back).
1st Update: Went to the basement this morning to discover that the guys working had broken the drainage pipe for our bathroom sink and they used a Romex power wire we have running in the basement to hang their new pipe on. Will update review if AquaGuard returns to fix the issue.

name: Robert Carver
text: Very pleased with Aqua-Guard's work. Mike was good to work with, and the installation team did a great job. Because of my general interest in the approach I observed the entire process. The install team clearly knew what they were doing, and functioned together like a well-oiled machine. In some areas they exceeded my expectations. Good estimation process, good installation, and good price. I recommend without hesitation.

name: Ryan H
text: Aquaguard was fantastic throughout the entire process. Mike was very easy to work with and did a great job addressing all concerns. We had several companies come out and quote the job and as it so rarely turns out these guys had the lowest price as well as the most intelligent solution. One of the other companies wanted to sell us a similar system with an unnecessary pump system for almost twice the price of AG. Due to our property being on a heavy slope it made more sense to have the water gravity fed from the basement to have one less thing to worry about maintaining. Mike saw the reason in this approach and explained while some applications do require a pump ours did not and so was able to design the system to accommodate our individual situation as opposed to saying “This is our system. It’s the same for everyone”. On the day of the job the crew showed up on time with a supervisor to address any concerns before starting the job. Everything was completed and cleaned up in a matter of hours. They didn’t leave a mess and did exactly what they said they would. Tough to find these days, especially at a reasonable price!!  I would highly recommend this company. Not only did they knock it out of the park installing a water proofing system that is working like a champ but also offer a warranty for the life of the structure which is as good or better than anything else I was able to find while researching how to solve the water issue. Thanks guys for a great experience well worth the money!!!

name: Jodie Mote
text: Mike/Aqua Guard was great to work with and did a great job with our crawl space encapsulation.  It immediately helped with our temperature issues and gave us a ton of additional storage.  They recommended an option much cheaper than another company who appeared to be trying to sell me a lot of stuff I didn't need for my intended use.

name: Farrah Mote
text: Aqua-Guard was highly recommended to me by numerous people. They lived up to their recommendation with their quality of work, quick turnaround and professionalism. Mike provided the perfect solution for our crawl space and a quote that was much less than others. I highly recommend Aqua-Guard for your waterproofing needs.

name: Scott McGriff
text:
We used Aquaguard 3 years ago (2016) to waterproof a finished room on the lower level of our home.  The process they use has kept us from having any water intrusions since and we no longer have even a hint of the musty smell that we had been dealing with for years.

I would definitely recommend their product/service.

name: Marion Yester
text:
In 2011 we moved into an older home on a beautiful small lake.
In 2012 our area experienced an unprecedented amount of rain and we were surprised to find that water was accumulating along the back wall of the workshop. We called several companies in Birmingham and got their suggestions as well as estimates.  Aqua-Guard impressed us with their range of options, their patience and a more reasonable price.  They came out and put in one of their systems and we have had no trouble in that area since.
In 2016 we again had a tremendous amount of rain and this time, water came in on the other side of the house.  We, of course called Aqua-Guard and were pleased to find out that they could extend the system to include the new section.  They even let us do some of the prep work and saved us money!
In 2018, again a lot of rain and water was coming in near the corner of the workshop door.  We worked with Aqua-Guard to do some problem solving.  For a few weeks it was a mystery.  They never gave up. But then Mike Shofner and my husband came up with a very creative solution.  We could not be happier.
If any other water problem should arise, we would never consider calling anyone other than Mike and Aqua-Guard.  They get our strongest recommendation and would encourage others to give them a call!

name: Andrew Golson
text: Very professional.  Their quote was $5k+ less than their competitor and significantly less invasive.  The system works perfectly and their team was fast and efficient.  Lifetime guarantee on their work as well.  Brett their sales manager came back out personally and adjusted something to my liking.  Would highly recommend.

name: harrykat 0ne
text:
This is one great company, they did the work promptly and the quality of their work is way above average! Very trained and professional crew who did an outstanding job! No complaints at all, would highly recommend!
Jeff Rominger..Hoover

name: trevor lundstrom
text:
We dealt with Mike the owner of Aquaguard.  I had a quote from a competitor that was several thousand dollars more expensive.  Mike looked at their quote said he would do same thing for considerably less, roughly half price.  He was also more professional and was present during the start of the job unlike the other company who schedules subcontractors to install their product.  I always prefer to deal with family owned companies for better customer service and pricing.

He supervised the job and coordinated an inexpensive electrician to remove the fuse box from the garage wall, and install outlet.  The entire job was finished in a half day and they cleaned up after themselves.  The lifetime warranty is another added benefit.  You will not go wrong with Aquaguard.  Get their free estimate and see for yourself.

name: Thomas Glover
text: Just had our first big rain of the year. Normally, we would water leaking through the walks but we had aqua guard come out and put in a system to keep the water out of the garage and basement. Hard working crew. Very professional and lowest price.

name: Chris Williams
text: Misrepresentation of the scope of the job.  Bad communication from the get go.Didn’t call just showed up when they wanted.  Customer service didn’t  mind the crew cutting an electrical cord in my wall and then just swiping electrical tape over it( very dangerous). Overall did not come out to understand my concerns or care about them at all. Poor poor poor customer service and communication.

resp.text: I am very sorry you feel this way, but I would like to address the issues listed.  I communicated with you about the wall clearance and what needed to be done prior to us doing the work. A copy of the contract was left with you on the day of the estimate that listed the work that needed to be done in order for us to waterproof your basement. This quote was given 4 months before you called to schedule the project.  Our office called you the week before your scheduled project to confirm the appointment and an approximate time the crew would arrive.  Our communication is the same with all of our customers.  On the day of the appointment you signed the contract that listed prep work that needed to be done and it was explained to you again on the day of the job.  Our crew did the prep work for you, which was your responsibility, at no additional cost to you. It is extremely important to me to keep our reputation and customer satisfaction at the highest level possible. I am not sure what we could have done differently to communicate to you about your project and what needed to be done.  I have reached out to you with no response.  I am not sure what more I can do to help you.

name: David Shaw
text: Mike and his crew did an amazing job waterproofing our basement.  Very professional, great price and done on time.

name: Ken
text: The Aqua-Guard Team was on time, efficient, and hard-working.  Thanks to Mike, Tina, Brett, and the Installation Techs for the value add to our home!!

name: The Aubins
text:
Aquaguard installed a waterproofing in my basement and encapsulation in my crawl space 2.5 years ago. The GOOD: The price was very competitive, Mike (owner) seemed very honest detailing the work to be performed, the crew completed the job quickly, and I haven’t had any water intrusion issues since. THE BAD: following the completion of the job I noticed several items that looked suspect - caulking around door, window, fireplace, and at end of wall sheets was missing or poorly done, sump basin cover had a large cutout and therefore not well sealed, encapsulation in crawl space was made up of what looked like a lot of scrap peices haphazardly taped together and noticeable creases in the tape joints. I didn’t call Mike to come back out because I figured they were the pros and the installation methods were acceptable and/or industry standard - i.e not items I should be concern about. Well... 2.5 yrs later, I’m having issues with the tape joints separating and releasing moisture and foul odors from the soil gases escaping the encapsulation in my crawl space that are coming up into our main level. I contacted Aquaguard and was told that it’s been too long since the install for them to correct the problem free of charge. the customer service representative basically stated that “if the waterproofing system isn’t leaking then it doesn’t fall under their warranty.” So much for standing behind your work. If the encapsulation membrane would have been taped correctly we would not be having this issue. Note* I have already addressed the poor caulking and sump basin lid on my own as to not be a “needy customer”.

Interesting bit of info... I called BDry about this as I thought they had done the waterproofing. They sent a rep out the next day, he checked the encapsulated crawl space, agreed it was not installed acceptably, and said they would be sending someone out to correct the problem before end of week. Unfortunately, I’ve realized they didn’t perform the work originally so I called them off.

name: Tracy Thornton
text: Awesome company!!! Would recommend to anyone!!!

name: LA
text:
Totally agree with the review posted by Gary. Purchasing a home built by Benchmark would NOT be in your best interest!! Unless you would like a huge headache by no one that cares from the GET GO. This was the first home that I’ve purchased in the area and I definitely won’t buy another from this company. I had no clue what I was in for, but if I could save someone else the devastation, DO NOT DO IT!!

A BRAND NEW HOME with NUMEROUS issues one could not even make up, all of which is a result from the obvious lack of pride and quality in their work. I am going to refrain from posting a book of a review and what energy I do have left and just say DO NOT purchase a home from Benchmark. Throw your money on the ground and walk away. Better yet, donate it to a good cause so you can at least feel good about the choice that you have made. I do hope someone takes these reviews seriously in their consideration when purchasing a home. Once I actually thought things were going to get taken care of, little did I know that this headache is never ending!! From Sheetrock seams present all over the house, to plumbing leaks, window leaks, wall bulges, fraying and dented doors, and the list goes on....all I’ve gotten is excuses as to why things are this way in order to get me to believe that these mishaps are ok and normal in a brand new home!!! NOT the case!! I’ve owned a brand new home previously in a different area and still to this day, 9 years later, I would make a bet you still could not find this type of work in that home.

If you have not gotten the message yet, you should by now!! However, let me add that NONE of this was able to be seen prior to moving in. So do yourself a favor upfront and do not even go this route, because 3 months of living in the house and things are only getting worse.

name: Gary
text:
Poor quality construction and workmanship. Calling the customer service poor is an understatement. From the beginning we had issues getting calls returned or obtaining information. This should have been an obvious red flag, but we avoided our instincts and have sorely regretted it since.

Benchmark obviously does not stand behind their product based on my experience thus far. They are not concerned with you as a customer . Once you've closed, good luck getting anything fixed. The "Superintendent" is an excuse machine from walkthrough to present day. The "warranty" department will provide you with vague generalizations and open ended time frames. If you're considering Benchmark, just toss your money out the window, it would be much more efficient.

Your closing will likely be delayed because they forgot to submit something, or do something, or just simply needed a day off. These are primarily guesses on my part because we were told nothing. We never were provided insight on the revolving closing date, until the 11th hour on the 3rd scheduled closing date. Eventually we found out our initial date passed because the COO was not submitted properly, and then the house failed inspection. Our closing was repeatedly delayed and their solution was for us to wait it out or walk, they didn't care. I would not recommend purchasing from them unless every other home in the area is sold.

name: Michael Nicholson
text: Won't help with an issue that they installed improperly. Was told tough luck!

name: William Lawrence
text: Great experience. Mr. Radcliff is awesome to work with.

name: S. A. N.
text:
Choose Benchmark Homes only if a) you don't care about the appearance of your home, b) you don't mind having unlevel floors and ceilings, c) you don't mind paying for upgrades that can't be professionally installed, d) you don't mind having woodwork done with the precision of a circus monkey, and e) you don't mind dealing with people who acknowledge that a problem exists but fail to take any action to correct it.

In the most exposed area of my home, the kitchen, the crown molding, for which I paid an upgrade fee, is falling down.  This, by the way, is the replacement work. The first installed crown molding did the same thing (started falling apart) within six months after I moved in.  The "replacement" took so long that the one year warranty had expired.

I complained about this in February, when my house was approximately 14 months old, and the superintendent came to my house to view the problem.  He said that the ceiling was  unlevel and that this was causing the problem.  He asked what days worked for me and said he would send some of his crew, which was working out of town at the moment, to fix the problem.  It's almost August, and I have yet to hear another word from the superintendent to schedule a repair.

Since I am beyond the period covered by the 2-10 home warranty, which is basically garbage anyway and only designed to protect the builder from litigation, I am stuck with the burden of correcting Benchmark's faulty work.

Choosing Benchmark Homes is one of the biggest regrets in my life.  Buyers beware!

name: Sharon Camp
text: The Business KNOWINGLY employs sex offender. Man employed who was convicted of 1st Degree Sexual Assault of a 13 yr old girl. I wouldn't want them near my house or property.

resp.text: This is a false statement. In reference to this man he was never an employee of Pro Construction, LLC and was actually a subcontractor and once Pro found out about the status of this subcontractor our relationship with this man was terminated. We do our best to screen our in house workers but don't do background checks on Subcontractors. Pro Construction, LLC values our 19 yr Accredited A+ Rating with the Better Business Bureau and our wonderful customers that we always strive to serve and protect to the best of our ability.

name: Pat Ferguson
text: Always fast and friendly. ..great products

name: Jody Brown
text: This business is not very publicly active with followed or visitors of their business and is also not very known to answer the phone

name: Rickey Shaneyfelt
text: Very friendly people

text: If I could give no stars I would. They say they are a family company...NOT TRUE!

name: Frederick Jones
text: I've worked on a job site today with this company. A guy named Tim "Dog" is his knick name, is a racist person who put me off the job site because I gave a none vulgar opinion. I told Tim that I didn't mind getting put off of his job site is all I said. Tim is a hard person to work with, he should be investigated and terminated. If Robins & Morton would allow a person of this nature to work for them this clearly shows what type of company this is.

name: Terrance Archer

name: Ashley Evans
text:
James Cooper has the worst attitude ever. He belittles and speaks to others like they are dirt. He only received one star bc I had to select in order to write this review.
DO NOT USE HIM!!! I will make sure my word of mouth travels and fast!!

name: Carolyn Nance
text: Freedom Pools is where I bought our above ground pool years ago.They have always been eager to give advice for any problems and are well stocked on all your pool supplies.Thanks for advice and help through the years.God Bless

name: Lisa Owens
text: Their quality has went down over the years, we purchased a pool from them in 2004, it was a great pool kept it for 14 years, we purchased another pool in 2019, its cheaper made and quality of service installing the pool is terrible. Every hose and connections are chalked to the point if you need to remove anything for any reason it is so difficult. The old pool we had nothing was chalked, so you remove hoses and put back together. The chalking make the up keep take much longer. The pool for vaccumming was bent and I had to replace it, the self vacuum the sold me does not self vacuum that great.

name: Billy watkins
text: These folks are great!  We had a problematic pool, but they kept coming back when they said they would or sooner, until it was fixed!  Won't use anyone else!

name: CINDY GANTT
text: They are great people. Very helpful. Always answer my questions. Service after the sale as well. I would highly recommend Freedom Pools.

name: Amanda Riker
text: I bought my pool right before spring 2014. Staff was very helpful and ordered my pool. They didn't try to sell me something I didn't need or want. I paid in full for the pool and installation. We set a date for them to come out and they called before to let me know they were coming. They did a great job prepping the  ground because my pool is very level. As a new pool owner, I was calling the store constantly to ask questions. All of which were answered. I would recommend this business to anyone wanting to buy an above ground pool at a reasonable price.

name: Jess Coonrod
text: Went in to ask questions on things we needed for our pool and spa, and the owner was very helpful giving us the info we needed.  He directed us to a person that helped us get our spa diagnosed. He also gave us info on what we need for our pool.  Very Helpful and when we are ready to buy our Jacuzzi we will be getting it from him!

text: I have bought two spas and a pool table from Freedom Pools. They are very honest about their products and give great prices. Very friendly owner and staff.

text: I am a Journeyman Carpenter for Taylor and Miree Construction,I enjoy working with them and The Owners are Operating the company , great fellowship with the employees......

name: Kelly Waller
