text:
These guys did a great job.  Steve was very though at explaining everything.  He had all the proper licenses.  Many in this business do not.  A1 was very competitive and gave me 1 extra year of labor warranty for free.  Thanks again Steve.
Bobby

name: Jenna Ruddock
text: I'm extremely pleased with the service from A1! I called them first thing the morning after a miserable night without air conditioning and they promptly sent out technician, Tyler. Tyler was able to explain what  the issue was and fix the problem in the most cost effective manner. He was very respectful and professional and the whole process was easy. I appreciate a company that works so quickly and has people who will go the extra mile! I will definitely recommend these guys to my friends and neighbors in the future!

name: Genea Lawrence
text: This was the best and easiest experience I have ever had with a company! Zach came out Monday figured out what was wrong with my unit. Came back Wednesday afternoon and had it fixed with in an hour! Thank you so much Zach for the AWESOME work! I highly recommend A1 Heating and cooling! Will forever use them!

name: Collin Langley
text: I recommend Zach, he was exceptional and by the best AC technician I have had out to my house. Fixed my issue and gave multiple options in terms of what I wanted to pay. Charged me 89$ for a fee (normal), and then charged me 11$ to assess and reroute some ducts.

name: Ann Creager
text: We started having problems with our heat pump and called a company that was recommended to us. The gentleman came out and repaired in about an hour and a half, left with system running. Less than 2 months later, unit went out again. So I began my google search for heating repair; found A1 Heating and Air with great reviews. Called Steve and they came out same day, late Friday evening. Steve and his tech did everything they could but the unit was not salvageable. Steve ordered new unit on Saturday morning and it was going to be a few days before it could be delivered and installed. To my surprise, after worrying about the cold weather that had invaded us early in the season, Steve shows up, with daughter in tow on a family day, brought us 4 room heaters to get us through the cooler nights. He did this on his day off, while spending time with his family and under no obligation; just a super guy with his customers concerns and well-being a priority. Pricing was more than fair and better than the competition that we checked into. A1, from Steve to techs, are very professional, courteous and knowledgeable about the work they do and products they sell. I am very pleased and satisfied with their work and pricing, and recommend them to anyone needing heat and air repair/replacement. I will never call another heating and air company, A1 is the only company for us in the future. Thanks Steve and Chris.

name: Rita Sumners
text: I liked the price, the service and the people. Chose them because of the reviews and haven't been disappointed. I was impressed by the way they worked together.

name: Becky Pierson
text: Impressed again with A1, Zach came out diagnosed my problem, replaced the part and had me working again in no time.  Zach was professional and thorough, our family will not trust any other company for our AC and heating needs.  Thanks again A1.

name: Neal
text: This is an amazing AC company... Zach, Steve, Nelson, Alex are all outstanding!!! My family had some serious issues with our AC and Zach came out and diagnose the issue. He fixed the issue long enough for is to replace one of our units. Steve, Nelson, and Alex came and replaced a unit in about 4 hours which I thought was amazing. They are very professional very knowledgeable and go over the top for their customers. Once you do business with them they treat you like family. We would HIGHLY recommend them for anyone that has AC needs. We'll never use anyone else ever again.

text: A1 was wonderful! They responded very shortly to my phone call even though it was a Saturday. They were very accommodating in finding a day and time that worked well for me. I was given an appointment day and time with Tyler. I received and email reminder the morning of and then Tyler texted when he was on his way. He was prompt and friendly. He was very knowledgeable and quickly fixed our issue. I recommend them highly and will call them again.

text: Great service, quick diagnosis, and got out to us first thing in the morning.  They also do a military discount.  Support local businesses!

name: David Cole
text: When I decided that our old system was just not going to make it through another cold season "I started shopping".  I called several well known companies around town to give us quotes and try to learn about the different brands and features.  I am very analytical to say the least.  After talking to A1 for a while I realized they were going to be the most informative without becoming irritated with me like other companies, and my wife sometimes does!  I really appreciated that because this is a lot of money to us and we want to understand just what it is or isn't that were buying.  A1 was the most economical for the services provided and gave us the best warranty.  A1 installed our system and did a great job!  Thanks again for everything Steve!  We will always recommend you to our family and friends.

name: tammy jolley
text: Great response!   Several others wouldn't even come take a look,  they would only quote a new unit.   Steve was Very honest and actually tried to save me money but pointed out the risks as well.   If i need a new unit,  they will get my business!

name: David Higginbotham
text: These guys recently helped me service a HVAC unit that was still under warranty.  Zach (the tech assigned to me) came in special on a Saturday to diagnose the issue....that was greatly appreciated.  There were a couple of issues outside of his control that brought him back a couple of times to remedy the problem and he was always prompt and professional.  Sharon took care of the scheduling and she kept me updated on Zach's arrival time via text message.  That's a courtesy you don't always get but it made things super convenient and low hassle.

name: Christie Sanders
text: Over Labor Day weekend our AC went out! We knew immediately that we would call A1 Heating and Cooling, since we had used them the previous year for our lower level unit. The service on both occasions was extraordinary - we received an immediate response and quick repair (even on Labor Day). Steve exceeds all of our expectations when it comes to customer service. I would highly recommend him and his company to any of my friends or family.

name: Bill Case
text:
I found A1 extremely prompt and professional with fair pricng. We chose to have them repair instead of replace, but will definitely contact them if a unit needs replacing.
UPDATE: a year later, our other unit reached end-of-life and A1 replaced it quickly with a Bryant.  We had a couple of minor issues, which were quickly addressed, but then had a coolant leak at 7 months, which required a back-ordered part, so A1 chose to replace the entire unit instead of waiting. Amazing service by Steve, Zack and Nelson.

name: Thomas Castor
text: Tyler was prompt and fixed problem quickly.  Made sure we understood what else needed done. Very satisfied!

name: Daniel Bell
text: A1 replaced my home HVAC unit in April 2019, and I highly recommend them. The customer service was outstanding, and the technical staff was very knowledgeable.

name: Scott’s Sanders
text:
Steve showed up on time and was very personable. Diagnosed the situation and repaired the unit. This all was done in a timely and professional manner and at a great price.
I highly recommend this company.

name: Leslie Moody
text:
Steve with A1 Heating and Cooling has been extremely helpful to us on two different occasions.  As luck would have it, each of our AC units went out on summer holidays!  Even on a holiday, Steve understood the urgency of being without AC in the Alabama summer heat.  He didn't use our bad luck to his advantage to gouge us with outrageous emergency pricing.  Each time, he was thorough in helping us understand what was wrong with the unit and what needed to be done to correct the problem in the most cost effective way.  Steve even followed up the day after repairs to be sure were happy with the work that had been performed!

I've rarely experienced such excellent  customer service and would highly recommend A1 Heating and Air Conditioning.

name: Tim M
text: First, I want to say that all of these glowing reviews about Steve are completely valid! HE IS A 5 STAR REPAIRMAN! My wife found A1 on Google while I was away on business and our AC was on the fritz. She decided to go with them based on their stellar reviews. I returned just in time to meet Steve as he arrived to diagnose the problem with our AC unit. He found the problem (bad capacitor) in a matter of minutes, had the replacement part on his truck, and had our system pumping cold air within 15 minutes of his arrival. He was professional and courteous. Above all, he was respectful and didn't try to act like his work was too complicated for me to understand. He explained everything he was doing and reassured us that, if anything went wrong with the AC, we could call him and he'd come back to make things right. I felt very comfortable with our conversation. Steve is my AC guy. Trust him with your repair needs. He will take care of you.

name: Chris Messervy
text: After having HVAC problems and receiving wrong information from several other technicians, we began to look for a knowledgeable, honest and reasonable technician.  We called Steve after reading several good reviews online.  He came and assessed the situation. He thoroughly explained what we needed and why. He was prompt in his scheduling and came exactly on time.  He was very professional and did excellent work in removing and replacing our old compressor and handler.  Compared to other quotes received, his pricing was very competitive.  We are happy to now have a dependable technician to call!  We will definitely be passing his card along...Thanks Steve!

name: Adam O
text: Steve with A1 Heating and Air has been a pleasure to do business with in the middle of the stressful situation of having A/C problems. After a phone call on a Friday evening, he showed up first thing Saturday morning and quickly diagnosed the problem, all while teaching me what he was doing to satisfy my curiosity. Steve is professional, very knowledgeable, extremely friendly, and really seems to enjoy his work. He ordered my warranty-covered parts for me to prepare for installation a few days later (due to my schedule constraints - not his) and kept me updated with text messages and phone calls along the way. I highly recommend Steve and A1 Heating and Air.

name: Alexandra Jackson
text: Great guys and great service. They showed up early and actually spent the time to diagnose the problem with our system. Steve explained the different options to us and made us feel 100% sure about what we were getting into. Will use again in the future if need be.

name: Jeremiah Raemhild
text: A1 services was quick and efficient. Zack was very professional and top notch. I will be using A1 for all my future AC repair needs!!!!!

text: Quality work. Steve called me back within an hour, and set up an appointment to diagnose my interesting situation. Came out on time, was extremely professional, helpful, and willing to work with you and answer any inquiries you might have. I will recommend him and the company to anybody who has A/C needs.

name: Blake Autin
text: The owner and operator, Steve, is a great guy and responded to my request for service the day I called. The company is licensed and bonded, and Steve even made sure to give me his license and bonding information so I could looking him up and confirm. Steve arrived on time, quickly diagnosed what was wrong with my system, and had it running in no time.  This company had high ratings on all the rating sites I went to when I was looking for an AC repair company and after Steve was done I knew why.  I have recommended this company to all my family and friends.

name: Don Holt
text: We called Steve about our heating unit shorting out and blowing fuses. He set an appointment time with us. He was right on time. Not something you see any more in the service industry.  Right away, he impressed me with his friendly and easy going manner.  He took time to question us on the problem we were having and what we had done to correct it. He then methodically proceeded to run down the problem. He tried one thing at a time, until he found the problem and fixed it. His fee was quite acceptable.  We were so impressed that we ask for a handful of his business cards to pass out.  I recommended him to my parents. Something I do not usually do.  I feel completely confident that he would do an honest and trustworthy job for them. And, for anybody else.

name: John Cote
text: Steve did a fantastic job discovering the problem with our A/C system and he saved us a ton of money by fixing a system that was  only 7 years old. We got a couple of other quotes and they all wanted us to replace the system at significant cost. Steve determined that the system could be repaired no problem. He is a man of  integrity, I wouldn't use any one else and recommend him highly.

name: Lindsay Izzo
text: Steve really is the best!! My renters had an A/C unit go out on them and he had the part replaced the next day. He is very professional and an extremely kind man. I would recommend him any day of the week.

text: I've used A1 Heating and Cooling several times now.  Each time the technician arrived on time and was extremely pleasant and efficient.  I'll definitely call them again if I have any other issues.

name: Alex Khaimenov
text: I am so glad I met Steve! He gave me an honest opinion on my system and saved me a lot of money on a new one. He is my new to go to guy!

name: Phillip Zink
text:
Excellent service, excellent product, excellent group of people to work with. The unit we had was original to the house and going on 22 years old.  So it came as no surprise to us when it finally decided to start being more hassle to upkeep than just flat out replace.  Our unit stopped working on a Sunday morning.  The fan motor had gone bad and no hot air would come through the vents.  It would kick on and off intermittently, but very sporadic and unreliable.  We called around and left messages at a few places.  Steve was the first to call back that same day. We explained the situation.  He advised us to use the unit if we could and wanted to make sure we did still have some heat.  Being that it was a Sunday, it would be Monday until he could send someone out unless it was an absolute emergency.  Come Monday, a technician, Juan, came out to check the problem.

Juan was polite, informative and an all-around great guy.  We were given a quote to repair the unit and replace.  Juan took the time to break down everything for us if we had any questions.  We shopped around and found A1's price to be fair and put the order in for a replacement.  Steve, himself, came by the house the next day to talk with us and clear up any questions we had and help discuss cost options. We decided to go with A1. Juan and Steve were back out first thing that Friday and had the unit replaced and operational in 4 hours.

We'll be sure to continue to use Steve and A1 for any of our future needs for HVAC.

name: Robert F Stierwalt (Fred)
text: Great group to work with.

resp.text: Thanks,  Robert same here.

Very honest!

name: Jerry Curiel (lastcall)
text: The compressor in Unit a Goodman I had for several years worked fine but it suddenly died Juan the Service tech @ A1 Service , came and surveyed the Goodman and quickly had my compressor replaced about 3 months passed and the Unit stopped cooling, this time I noticed the Fan outside stopped spinning and no cool air was coming out from vents -  I called again and Juan the Service tech came again and found a wire loose and got me on the road to cool air conditioned again ,by this time I - Me - discussed the longevity of my goodman Air conditioned Unit Versus getting a New Unit put inn , and he said "This unit might get you through the summer and if you still feel you might want to replace it we have several alternatives you can look at  to see what is best for you" I felt very comfortable with his answer, Long story Short . I called  back and I'm having the whole house unit replace and changing to Gas instead of a Heat pump a 98% efficient and a whole house comfort control including a variable speed Seer 19 Carrier with a 10 year warranty. Juan was and has been very helpful and I felt no pressure sales  from him, I had suggested a Trane instead of Carrier and he said that whatever I wanted it wold be fine with him, I will surely recommend, A1 Aircondition to all my friends, Oh I have ordered the Unit and it will be installed at my convenience, like next week,l

name: Mrs. Howze
text: Tyler was very professional and friendly!  Great service!

name: Daniel Pollard
text: Great product, installation and subsequent service on this and other heat pumps .Responsive and Pleasure to deal with. Very competitive pricing

name: Todd Aycock
text:
Saved me $1600!!

I had another HVAC come out and give me a $1600 bill to repair my air conditioning system (even though when the technician left, it was working again).  I thought this seemed high, and I got Steve's number from a friend at work who recommended A1.  I called and Steve came out and thoroughly examined my system because he was suspicious of the repairs the other company had listed.  Sure enough, he found that almost all of the parts (except for one small heating element, unrelated to the cooling problem) were working fine.  He also completely explained how my system worked to me, he verified that it was working properly, and he was extremely courteous and professional the entire time.  Probably the best experience I have ever had with a service technician.

Considering that he could have easily "charged me less" to fix the non-existent problem, due to my lack of knowledge about HVAC, and considering that he wouldn't let me pay him a service fee because he just wanted to prevent me from getting screwed over, it seems clear that Steve has extremely high integrity.  I would definitely recommend him and will be using him as my HVAC service and installation company for the foreseeable future.  Beware of other local Huntsville companies (seems they like to up-charge) and go with A1 if at all possible!

name: Jason Bolduc
text: My air conditioning went out when it was 100*, I called Steve at AI Air conditioning and Heating, he showed up within 30 minutes and within just a few minutes already knew what part went bad, he replaced the bad part and anwered all questions I had concerning air conditioning, he went on to educate me more in the field, he also fixed our heating unit back in the winter,  I was extremely impressed with Steves knowledge in air conditioning and heating and how he cares about treating people right, he is trustworthy and I recommend him over ANYONE if you need your air conditioning or heating unit fixed.  I feel fortunate I called Steve at A1, he will be our only contact person for any future air/heat concerns as I need only a professional.

name: me to you
text:
Update:  7 Dec 2020.  After a year of begging Alms Pump to come reconnect the electric wires in the older pump house that they disconnected to put a check valve,  I had to hire an electrician ($126) to come restore electricity in the pump house so that the lights could be turned on for freezing weather that was 2 days after the 2 days of freezing weather.  The bulb receptacle that was removed without my permission was bought and remounted as the backup bulb.
It makes no sense to mistreat a customer who is a disabled Army Veteran and have been a loyal paying customer.

Buyer beware

Alms pump does not care about their customers.  You cannot trust them to do the job right especially if you leave them and trust that they will do right by you.   I paid $450 for a check valve but the aggravation they caused me for a year to reconnect the electric wires they disabled, removed a light bulb socket without my permission, and had leaking pipes at the new pump, I should charge them $500 or more.

So, buyer beware.
*********************************
Nov 10, 2020 update:
Alm Pump finally came to fix the leaking pipes..  Hurricane Sally busted the leaking pipes open and water was pumped on the grounds for 2 to 3 days and nights. It could have burned up the new pump. I wondered why there were 4 inches of water on the ground 3 days after the hurricane. Wading through the water, I discovered the pump gushing water from the pipe at the pump.  I shut off the power to the pump. Then called Alms Pump.
Their reply was that they had people without water and it would be a couple of days. Well, about 6 weeks later Alms Pump showed up and fixed the pipes to the pump and turned the water back on.  The bill for that meter where no water was used was $60.  This was the first bill where payment was only for water used plus taxes.
As to the older pump, Alms Pump  never went to the  pump house of the older pump and never reconnect the electric wires they disconnected to bring the pump and pipes out of the ground to put a new check valve on the pipe of the older pump.
I have begged Alms Pump to reconnect the wires in the pump house so that the electric plugs can be used to run extension cord to where 2 junipers fell in the yard and need cutting.  To this day, Nov 10, 2020, the 2 juniper are still down.
There is no electricity to the switch for the light bulb when freezing weather comes.

My attorney wrote Alms Pump  a letter and it was ignored.  I gave Alms Pump until 31 Oct 2020 to reconnect the electric wires and that was ignored.

They will not answer as to why they will not reconnect the electric wires they disconnected.  I paid Alms Pump $450 for repairing the older pump (putting in a new check valve).
If I have to hire an electrician to reconnect the wires Alms Pump disconnected, would that make Alms Pumps liable for the payment? My attorney says yes, and, they should be taken to Small Claims Court.

The senior Alms who started Alms Pump never mistreated their customers as I have been grossly mistreated by this younger generation running Allms Pump.

I will never call Alms Pump to put down another well and pump. Fini.

Previous post in Sep 2020:
Not responding to fix the leaking T under the valve they installed.  I have done business with Alms Pump for over 30 years and do not understand why they are not responding to come fix their work. A plumber would not touch it.

Alms Pump. Please come fix your work.

name: Michael Daniel
text:
8 years ago we hired Pickett Construction to install a new roof, gutters and downspouts, and vinyl siding on our home. The quality of workmanship was outstanding, and the work was completed in  only 5 days. My wife and I could not have been happier.

Then last month after a rain shower, we noticed water stains on the ceiling in two different rooms. Because Pickett installed the roof 8 years ago, we called them about the problem. Josh sent his roofer to our home to see if a cause for the water leak(s) could be found, because from the outside the roofing shingles were not damaged or missing and looked fine. However after a few minutes looking in the attic and walking the roof, it was determined that during construction of my home some 25 years ago, a handful of framing nails used to secure the plywood roof deck had missed the rafter below, and after all these years had begun to back out of the plywood deck, pushing up the roof shingle just enough to let water pass underneath. The roofer walked the entire roof looking for nails that were backing out (not just in the area of the water stains below, but the whole roof), removing all that he found, sealing the hole and making sure the roof shingle lay flat. Two days after the repairs we had a lot of rain, and no water leaks inside the house.

Once again, Pickett Construction has made my wife and I very happy, and I will not hesitate to call them in the future. It's nice to know that the quality of workmanship and professionalism we knew 8 years ago is still present today.

name: tb harvey
text: Hired these people to do light repairs and painting.  Took 3 weeks to complete the painting.  They did poor preparation work on several parts of the house.  They did not paint the rear door to my detached garage,though they painted the trim.  They bent the gutter on my garage and was balking at replacing it until I showed some video.  They did not remount one of my porch lights, nor did they reattach a lens to one of the driveway flood lights. They left trash in the yard and on the front porch and in the plants behind the house. They missed painting trim on one of the back doors.  They replaced a French door that was alarmed. They had to detach the alarm panel from the wall because the new door trim was slightly larger.  After they finished the alarm would not work nor did they remount the alarm panel...just left it hanging by the wires.  When I questioned them the reply was “we don’t do that kind of work.”  Overall the work was substandard and the post work cleanup nearly nonexistent. Cannot recommend these folks . I have pictures if you need to see.

text:
Pickett Construction replaced my roof and gutters a few years ago. They did such a good job that I called them when I was ready to replace the siding on my house. It turned out beautifully!
Alas, it had barely been done 4 months when another company dropped a ladder against it hard enough to seriously damage it. That company denied culpability. Nice,huh? I contacted Josh Pickett and he made a few calls and found that they had some siding in my style and color already in stock so I wouldn't have to shell out $300 for another box of siding. He then called his installers to see how much they would charge to swap out the few pieces of damaged siding. Mind you, this is four days before Christmas. Then I got an email saying it had all been fixed and when I asked how much my final bill was I was told "no charge"! Now that is the kind of company I will keep calling when I need repairs done. They bend over backwards to make sure they do the job right and that their customers are happy long term. I am looking forward to my next home improvement project with Pickett Construction.

I've had three experiences with Pickett Construction. All of them great. First; in the process of selling my home an inspection revealed hail damage on the roof and the determination that the tiles had to be replaced. Called Pickett. I've moved to the Gulf Coast but still have rental property in Jefferson County.  Insurance company review dictated the need of handrails for front steps. I had one month to get then installed or they would drop my coverage on the house. The Rental Management Company for that property got some quotes but I called Pickett Construction on my own. name: Kurt DeAngelis
text:
We decided to do a major renovation on our 30 year old split foyer in Alabaster. I had a huge wish list that far exceeded the funds I had available and had to prioritize needs, essentilas and desirables. Josh assisted me in mximizing the budget with a detailed proposal that enabled me to do this. Josh did a great job with my wife letting her see and select the tile, flooring and paint, etc.

Do you want to know if Pickett is versatile or can get the job done fast? Pickett did the following items in 17 days ... 350 feet of new privacy fence and gates, paint entire house exterior, re-roof covered deck, remove turbines and patch roof areas, repair rotted roof decking around chimney stack, re-flashed and re-roofed the area, installed new LED motion detecting security lights, installed new outdoor lighting over front door,replaced all windows with new double hung, double pane vinyl windows, installed new laminate/engineered word floors on the entire main level of the house, laid tile in both foyers, kitchen and den/study, replaced every interior door and all hardware, installed new ceiling fans in each bedroom and main foyer, removed wrought iron raining in foyer and replaced with wood and balusters, primed and painted all interior trim, scraped popcorn/acoustic ceiling from kitchen, repaired drywall issues in bedrooms and kitchen, textured and painted kitchen walls.

Any "extra" I asked about was repsonded with a written proposal so that there could be no confusion or disaggrement.

To get these things done in the time frame of 17 days ... including holidays ... shows excellent planning and execution. I was kept informed as to what was scheduled for the day, who would be there and what to expect. They arranged for the construction dumpster delivery and pick up. Pickett did a nice job on the site clean up as well.

Punch list items were few and far between and resolved promptly.

The only thing that would be close to a concern or a negative was the sub-contracting tile guy who was going through a diviorce while he did the job. He did not do a bad job but his distraction resulted in a couple of small punch list things that Josh had Tripp take care of. I was assured that they would not be using this tile guy in the future.

Would I recommend Pickett Construction to you? Absolutely. Want to see pics of the renovation? I have them. Will I use them again in the future? Absolutely. As a matter of fact, my daughter used them on a foreclosure she purchased in Calera. She got prompt thorough quality work done as well.

name: Tim Calhoun
text:
Pricing:
We contracted with Pickett to complete some work on our house to prepare it for sale. We were looking for some typical wood rot to be replaced and exterior paint. We also requested an interior paint quote. I think the quote was a bit high for the exterior work, but not so bad that I didn't go with their services. The quote for the interior painting was outrageous, so we opted for another painter. The other painter's quote was nearly $3000 less than the quote from Pickett. We were also having some plywood put in the ceiling of the carport, because the builder used interior drywall in our neighborhood. Pickett gave us a "complimentary upgrade" to beadboard instead of plain plywood. This really added a nice touch to the carport ceiling, and was an appreciated upgrade. They only requested 1/2-down to start the work, which we felt was certainly reasonable. They also honored their coupon they regularly have (often in the Alabaster Newsletter, or ValPack). We printed ours from the ValPack website.

Workmanship:
The quality of the exterior work was pretty good. There were a few spots where the painting got a bit "sloppy," but was overall good work. The beadboard in the carport made a great upgrade to our carport, and added a touch of "class" to an otherwise mundane area of the house. Unfortunately, due to our unusually cold winter, the holidays, and several bouts with rain, our work was regularly delayed. It took a bit longer than expected to complete, but didn't delay our schedule of listing the house. The little interaction I had with the crew was polite and courteous, though at times the project manager came across as mildly arrogant. Communicating with the PM via email was the best medium, although he sometimes took a bit longer than expected to return messages.

Post Work Follow-up:
Again, the delays in returning messages made for a challenge in clearing our post-work "punch list," but this was also around the holidays, so we conceded a bit.  Had there been more clear communication about workday expectations (e.g. workers will/will not be onsite today) this would have made for better overall feeling about the length of the job.
During our home buyer's inspection, they found more wood rot that was inadvertently overlooked by the crew. While I don't expect the painters to look over every square inch of the house (heck, neither did I!), it ended up being a significant portion of the chimney that had rotted out the edge of our masonite siding. One would expect that at least part of that might have been discovered and either repaired or at least alerted me to the potential change in an estimate so it could be repaired. When we approached our PM about correcting it, he gave us a price quote. After paying over $6000 for the original work, this was certainly unexpected, especially with their "1 year warranty." I spoke with Josh, the owner's son who is also in management with the company. He immediately started working with me to find a reasonable solution. I ended up having to pay a bit more, but we did come to an acceptable compromise on the final cost of the supplemental work. In the end, Josh personally stopped by the house to deliver the revised agreement and took pictures of the missed work. It turned out that the rot was more severe than even he expected. He opted to continue to honor that revised estimate and didn't charge anymore. Josh really worked hard to make a relatively displeasing situation wok out well in the end. Josh was absolutely committed to service and ensuring my end satisfaction. He even reached out after the supplemental work was completed to check in on my satisfaction, and knowing there was a bit of a sour taste, still wanted this Google Review. Josh knows what it takes to listen to customer concerns and immediately find a reasonable solution that works in the best interest of all parties. Had it not been for Josh's actions, my 4-star rating would have been a high 2-star, or low 3-star.

I must now begin the process all over again. If Brian had told me he couldn't work in my project or that is wasn't something they could handle, I'd have been fine with that. text: Excellent experience with Lisenby Construction.  Great work at a reasonable price.  Kept us informed throughout the entire process of remodeling a bathroom and painting 3 additional rooms.  Would definitely recommend this company.

name: Rick Harris
text:
Lisenby Construction just finished a three-week remodel of our kitchen and living room, and we could not be more pleased.  The project involved demo of some existing kitchen cabinets, replacement of a cook top and stove with a range, replacement of a vent hood, installing new kitchen lighting, laying tile, painting cabinets and bookshelves, painting trim, and painting walls.  All of this was handled by David's crew without having to sub out any work. The quality of the work done was really top-tier.  We used David's decorating consultant, Lindy, to help pick out colors, and the result has significantly brightened and beautified the two rooms where we spend most of our waking hours.

When you undertake a project that takes this much time, you quickly realize that you have invited some strangers into your home for a lengthy stay.   Well, the guys David sent did not stay strangers for very long.  They were cheerful, friendly, and helpful to us.  They added, without cost, some features to the project at our request, even though these features were not in the original contract-- for example, installing a dimmer switch in the kitchen, replacing flood lights in our dinette area so they would match the color put out by our new kitchen lighting, cutting out the trim along one wall of our living room so our bookcase could lay flat against the wall, and installing wall outlets in our bookcase.  They cleaned up after themselves every day and hauled away their own trash.  When they moved furniture around to do some painting, they always put it back where it had been.  It got to where we enjoyed having the company at our house.  At the end of the job, we were glad it was completed, but we were sorry to see the guys leave.

All the work was done with great attention to detail.  They found and installed tile to match our existing kitchen backsplash tile.  They worked on our project every weekday for three weeks.  On some days, they worked on our cabinet doors and bookcase at their shop, but on the days when they did not come, David always called us to let us know they would not be there and what they would be doing that day.

We will certainly call on Lisenby Construction if we undertake new remodeling projects.  Highly recommended!

resp.text: Thank you Rick for your kind words and for trusting us with your home remodeling needs!

name: Susan Schneider
text: The end product exceeded our expectations. The quality of the craftsmanship was excellent. The Lisenby team was courteous, professional and provided excellent quality work. I would recommend them to anyone anticipating a home upgrading.

resp.text: Thank you Susan! We enjoyed working with you guys! Your new Kitchen is beautiful!

name: Caitlin Singletary
text: This was our first remodel, and it could not have gone smoother! The team was easy to talk to, and they were easy to reach when we had questions. They kept us up-to-date on expectations and the timing of everything. The remodel took 4 days (from demo to completion). The team arrived early each day, and they even worked holidays. They cleaned up daily (vacuumed and cleaned stainless steel appliances). We were also impressed when working with a company they contracted with. While the other company was doing their part, the Lisenby team was present, and they made sure the job was done right/well. In fact, at one point, the Lisenby team told the other team to fix something before leaving. Overall, we were highly impressed, and we intend to work with Lisenby again in the near future when we do additional remodeling!

resp.text: Thank you for letting us work on your kitchen Caitlin, we will look forward to working with you again! And thank you referring to us as a team, we work hard on developing a team culture here.

resp.text: Thank you for allowing us to be of service over the years. We look forward to your next project! Having repeat customers like you, has been the key to our success!

name: Walt
text: My wife and I are first time home buyers. I've only been able to read and research the process of buying a house. We do not have a "buyer's agent" but instead are using a transaction broker(unbeknownst to us until after closing had begun). That being said, everything that I have researched recommended being there for the home inspection to see for your own eyes the problems and repairs that need to be made before making a decision on buying a house. Unfortunately only my wife could make part of the inspection as I could not due to work demands after the hurricane. Mr. Wesley made me feel like I was there and explained the concerns to me as if they were his own. Our transaction broker suggested that we not be "nit picky" so the deal would go through. With Mr. Wesley's help, we were able to find the issues that we would not, and could not budge on. I strongly recommend him to anyone based on our experience. He even took time out of his Saturday during the half time show to go over the report in more detail with me. In a world rife with carelessness, his personalized and detailed attitude was refreshing and really made us feel important. The most thanks from myself, my wife, and our children, to you and your team Mr. Wesley! If we ever go into closing on another home,  Delta Home Inspections will be the name on the inspection report!

name: T S Hoefker
text: Moving here from out of state, we were referred to Wesley Wilson by our realtor in the Mobile area.  We are relocated every few years related to our employment, and of all the home inspectors we have worked with over the last 30+ years, he was by far the best, most thorough, as well as competitively priced inspector we have used.  He took time to explain with any questions we had, and was also fairly priced with re inspection after repairs.  As a licensed contractor he also knows what to clearly look for and works for both buyer and seller in a positive manner in approach.  It was refreshing to cross paths with someone of this character...a good memory of our move here to the Eastern Shore.

resp.text:
It was gratifying to be a part of your transition to Spanish Fort. Beautiful home! As always, we are only a phone call away to assist as you settle in.

Thanks again,

Wesley
Delta Home Inspections

name: LaRose Oliver
text: I highly recommend Mr Wilson for your home inspection. When I called to schedule our appointment he was the one that answered the phone and did the scheduling. He was very professional and polite. The day of the inspection, he arrived early and let us follow him through the inspection step by step. He pointed out problems and answered all of our questions. We never felt rushed or hurried. He took his time and we never felt like he was trying to quickly get done to move on to the next home. Later that evening we received a full report complete with color photos that showed all of the issues. I highly recommend Mr Wilson for a home inspection. He will be my first choice if I should need anything else inspected.

resp.text:
As always I like to be on time and prepared to inspect your investment. The more eyes inspecting the better. What a fun day it was. Good luck moving forward and remember I am here for you, just a phone call away.

text:
Wesley made an appointment to come out on the weekend for a home inspection on very short notice (called him Thursday for an appointment on Saturday). He stayed for almost three hours to ensure that everything was checked out well and any concerns we had were addressed. He also told us that if anything came up, we were confused about anything, or wanted him to come look at something again, to just give him a call. The inspection report was very detailed with lots of pictures.

Wesley was great to work with and and the inspection was very reasonably priced. If we have any future need for a home inspection, we wouldn't hesitate to contact him again.

name: Lisa Mitchell
text: Wesley conducted a home inspection this morning on a home my husband and I are purchasing.  I was impressed when I spoke with him initially on the phone.  He was very personable and seemed to have a genuine concern about the job he would be doing.  He mentioned that he preferred have us there to interact with and discuss issues on site.  When we arrived this morning right from the start I felt like my concerns were taken seriously and addressed very professionally.  He even took time to look into things that were not part of the home inspection.  I had wondered about whether a particular wall had wallpaper or paint on it and as the very kind person Wesley is he took the time away from what he was doing to take covers off outlets and determined the walls were in fact painted and then discussed with me the best way to cover the existing paint job.  This was above and beyond what he came there to do.  This is just one example, there were a couple more times during the inspection where he stopped and offered his expert opinion on things.  The inspection he did was very thorough.  I could not be more pleased.  He was extremely honest with his findings and I 100% trust his judgement and advice.  I highly recommend his services to anyone needed a home inspected.  You will NOT be disappointed.  In fact I plan to keep him in my contacts.  He does repairs as well, but Alabama state law will not allow him to work for a previous customer within 1 year, but any repairs I need after 1 year I will be calling Wesley to do!

name: Jonathan Stuckey
text: I was referred to Wesley by a realtor. Being a first time home owner I was not sure what to expect and had many concerns. however, after meeting Wesley my worries were put to rest as we did a walk-through of our new home. He made suggestions on what we would fix he also went above and beyond by teaching a simple maintenance task that need to be done in a home regularly. He then took time to go over all the questions we had. Within hours of leaving the inspection he had sent over thorough but easy to read a report, it even included pictures. He made this step of buying our first home easy and I would recommend to anyone

He said at first it would take 3 days and it turned into 3 weeks.He told me if would only tear down what he could put back up, they tore 3/4 of the fence down .( we have 8 dogs).He never communicated with us , which was all I asked for. Never returned texts or phone calls.I felt like he took the $ and ran. He eventually told me his woes, personal problems as well as business. It was awful! Well Sally blew threw and we have no fence. No phone call or anything from John . I understand he’s out making more $$. But you have to take care of all your customers so you can grow. It was not a good experience, I wish him success but I would never recommend him.

name: Josh and Kristin Schmidt
text: We originally wrote a review for this business that was positive. He came out to stain our fence and we were satisfied with the work. However, after he came back to our home to ensure that we left him a good google review, he told us that he would come back and stain a small 6 foot section of fence that had to be replaced. It has been a month, and he still has not come back. His communication with us has been past rude. Not a professional business - also he charges quite a bit for his work. Just expected more for the money we paid.

name: kristin schmidt
text: We used this business to stain a fence. When we first contacted him, he seemed kind and knowledgeable. Once he finally did the work, he told us he would come back to stain a small 6 foot section of fence that had to be repaired. It has been a month and he has come up with every excuse as to why he hasn't come back. It would take him 15 minutes to stain that small section, but once he has your money - you are no longer a priority. Also, the way he spoke to me through messages was so unprofessional. I reached out to him on July 24th regarding the small section of the fence needing to be stained, and he told us he would come out as soon as he was in our neighborhood. After waiting 3 weeks to ask if he would be coming out soon - he told me to "be patient." I'm not sure how patient I need to be, but apparently if you want anything done on a timeline - then you're not being "patient." Just a warning to anyone who is looking for a professional business. This would not be it.

name: Peggy Castenholz
text: Paid for a fence- got 10 posts put up in over 3 months. We were patient and empathized with his excuses.  Finally he ordered some materials which just sat on our driveway for over 60 days always promising to show up and materials ended up unusable. Finally fired him- Still has not refunded any of our money-even offered a payment plan.. NOT A DIME.   We will  be seeing John McCadden in court

name: Linda Goins
text: I called John and sent him a couple of pictures of a fence I needed to have removed. He gave me a quote over the phone from looking at the pictures. He showed up the next day and did all the work very quickly and did a very very good job. I would recommend him and his crew.

name: Kaylee Fayard
text: We had absolutely the best experience and are so glad that we went with McCadden's Fencing! We had a few quotes done over the phone but when we called John he was out here that day and gave us a quote we couldn't turn down. We got a custom shadowbox fence that's turned out better than we could have even imagined! The men he has working with him are the sweetest and knew exactlywhat they were doing and had so much knowledge about the entire fencing process. Absolutely will be recommending Mccadden Fencing to everyone I know.

name: Laura Rodich
text: They do use screws, which is a plus, but have trouble fulfilling their promises as to how long the job should take. It's always longer, sometimes by a good bit! Also, during the hurricane two walls of their fence leaned in about 15°. My husband tried to right it with braces and to reinforce the posts by digging deep to pour more cement in and to his surprise he found there was very little cement in the holes in the first place! And what cement was there in many cases was just off to one side rather than having the post-centered in the middle of it. This gave our fence a weaker  foundation when the winds came. They enclosed my backyard a year ago and then came back a few months ago to enlarge the enclosure per my request. John always has excuses for why they are behind or why no one showed up that day...seems to have trouble keeping help and overextends himself by accepting too many jobs and not having enough workers to fulfill them in a timely matter

name: Justin Tucker
text: Great quality of work at a fair price!

name: Becky Glover
text: Very professional, hard working crew. He kept his word, got our fence up and made sure everything was just the way we wanted it. They use quality materials and built a top notch fence!! I highly recommend them!

name: Lori Weatherly
text: I went with McCadden’s Fencing bc of such good reviews & I am so happy I did! These guys are professional, reliable, & trustworthy; have fair prices and do great work! After completing one job, I immediately turned around and hired them for another. I wouldn’t hesitate recommending them!

name: greg w
text: John McCadden is a Joke. He requires a large deposit up front and then uses your money to finish other jobs he already has going. Once he receives your money it is nearly impossible to get a response from him. It took nearly 3 weeks to get my fence completed and the workmanship is horrible. Don't believe the positive reviews.

resp.text: I don't have an invoice for any Greg W? Call me 2519239922 with the weather the last three weeks and finding good help I'm behind and as far as my workmanship it's never sub par I don't leave a job until the customer is satisfied. I think your being unreasonable in life situations send me pictures of my sub par work so I can fix that as far as timing I'm still learning how to schedule and I'm sub par at it I can admit. But bashing my work that's not gonna work my pictures don't lie...

name: Annsley Machen
text: My husband and I hired McCadden’s fences on May 8th and paid the deposit on May 11th so John could order materials for our start date of May 18th. He did not get materials delivered until May 23rd and it was only half of what we needed for the job. The materials sat on our grass until June 1st, killing a large part of our new sod. John then decided he was going to sub out part the job to another contractor because he was so behind, but said he would finish the job himself. The sub-contractor started on June 1st and finished what he was supposed to on June 10th. He did a great job. At this point, we were waiting on John, once again. We have yet to hear from John, even after multiple calls and texts. We have two sides up and there is no sign that this job will be completed. I do not recommend this company and warn anyone who contemplates hiring McCadden’s fences.

resp.text: I'm dealing with lack of help and over scheduling with the lack of help happening right after I took on this job. I sent you the best guy I have to do the job. The deposit has paid for the vinyl fence and Tony to install it. I have been in the field trying to keep everyone of my customers happy and this one I did put on the back burner so to say. There was 1800 dollars still for the remainder of the other fence. You stated you were gonna use another company to finish up the job and due to the circumstances I felt that was the best option for us both. I'm sorry for the experience but I know the quality is there and that's what I stand for. I didn't wanna bring guys without any experience and throw it together.

name: Vernon Vyborny
text:
He has poor work ethics and his reviews needs to show this and is uncompleteness. He has treated me very poorly.

He has yet to properly fix my fencing, I repeatliy asked him to come over. Cement chunks as much as 5 inches above ground.

name: Jamie Bloodworth
text: We love our new privacy fence! These guys do great work, work fast, and use high end quality materials. Our new fence looks amazing and will last many many years! Highly recommend!!

resp.text: We love installing privacy fences. We take pride in our work and we owe all our success from customers like you!

name: Trey Reyes
text:
I'm so happy with the job you and your crew has done on my fence. The attention and effort to do the job right impressed me. Thank you for following up with me on the sealer and maintaining my fence. I would strongly recommend Mccadden' Fencing and Construction.

Thanks again

resp.text: Your the customer that contractors wants to provide services too. Thank you for the opportunity and kind words!

name: Lisa Adams
text:
We had damage from recent storm(Barry)and lost a huge portion of older privacy fence.  Got a referral from a friend who used McCadden Fencing and recommended the company. They were very responsive, totally professional and replaced our fence with a much more stable and beautiful design.
Their prices are very fair and reasonable. In fact, surprisingly, at the time, following Barry, they were covered up in work, but did not take advantage of the storm event.  Moved our project to a priority and I actually had to tell them to stop working and go home. It was late at night!
I will be calling on this crew for many years and their work goes beyond fencing!!!

name: Jesse wilson
text: McCadden's was the only fence company that I called who used screws in every aspect of the privacy fence. Others wanted to charge extra for screws because they only use nails. Also, he only used metal frame gates which was another plus. Overall, he did a great job and I recommend him 100%. He did approximately 220 ft of 6ft privacy fence in a weekend which included a 12ft drive gate and a 4ft walk gate.

resp.text: Thank you for choosing Mccadden's privacy fence. We stand by our screw only design. You can keep the horse I mean dog in the yard now!

name: Gene Montecchie
text: Mcadden's fencing recently built a beautiful privacy fence for a good friend of mine in Foley, Al. After seeing their quality of work I contracted them to build a landing and outdoor shower area at a client's house in Gulf Shores, Al. They did a great job. Finished On time and in budget. If a hurricane comes it will probably be the only thing left standing!

resp.text: We love to install privacy fences. Thank you for acknowledging my hard work as quality work.

name: Fred Stringer
text: I used McCadden’s Fencing & Construction to build a custom style fence in my back yard. I could not have been happier with the entire experience. The service was professional and the product was immaculate! I would definitely recommend!

resp.text: Thanks for the recommendation!

name: Stacy York
text: We met John by chance at a tire shop. The first thing we noticed about him was how mature he was for his age. We found out in talking to him that he was a young entrepreneur which is something we cherish and in so doing choose to support. We got his phone number intending to add him to our Network of contractors that we could refer to our clients. But he noticed a personal need on our behalf and immediately offered his services expecting to be doing so in charity. The job was not an easy one by any means. He not only fit us in to what should have been his personal time and sought out Tony who was another fencing contractor to have the help needed, but he came and built us the most beautiful fence we've ever seen. Thank you, guys! You are our forever fence and deck, guy John. Keep up the great work!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words!

name: Mary Trujillo
text: Did a great job in a timely manner. Would recommend them to anyone .

name: Teresa Lowe
text: Guys were great.  Very precise timely. Worked until job done... cleaned up afterwards... spotless... on quote... highly recommend.   My husband has apt. Complexes .... best fence crew hes ever had.  Lead installer best ever...... hey Carlos...... if you don't hire... you're making a mistake. .  Also they use screws instead of nails.... longer lasting... more durable.

resp.text: I keep thinking the reviews can't get any better and along comes this one. I'm grateful to install your privacy fence. Enjoy your new retreat!

name: Jeremiah Kolb
text: John McCadden and his crew did a great job!  Finished within budget and on time.

resp.text: Thank you for choosing us to install your privacy fence. Smooth sailing it was.

name: Perry Davis
text: Hello everyone I used mcCadden's fencing and it was the best decision iv made as far as home improvements. The fence look amazing. I would recommend mcCadden's fencing to any one who want a great fence.

resp.text: Thanks for the recommendation!

name: SWAVÈ Saed
text: Productive & organized staff, always timely, fair prices, beautiful work. These guys are true professionals and the owner is quick to respond.

resp.text: Wow! What kind words to broadcast about our brand! Thanks for the blessing.

name: Dino Martins
text: Darren was great to work with. We are not located locally, but Darren was able to handle all of the coordination. He was prompt, did exactly what he said he would, and completed the project on a timely basis. I would highly recommend Darren for all of your fence needs.

name: Gene Montecchie
text:
We've used Flawless for sever projects. The owner Darren was quick to get us estimates, showed up on the day he said he would and finished on time and within budget!

Family run business by people who have been in the area for multiple generations.  They do what they say they'll do.

Will definitely use again.

name: gracelyn osborn
text: Was very responsive and great with communication! They’re price is great and so was the fence they put up! Definitely recommend.

name: Becky Wilson
text: Darren put a new tile backsplash in my kitchen in two days only!!  He was always helpful and knowledgeable with all of my questions.  Would use this company again!!

name: Brooklyn Buskens
text: High quality work for my real estate clients!

name: Kevin Allen

name: Ms.Joyce Murphy
text: Trax did miracles on my property that another contractor had really messed!!! I’m forever indebted to Mr. Justin and his awesome crew. May you be blessed with dozens of contracts and prosperity!

text: Ok

name: Ryan O'Neal
text: very unsafe, careless, pay more attention to what's going on around your equipment, or hire operators who will. Talked to one of the job site Forman and he was very careless and had a F you attitude.  not a company I would recommend.

name: NATE BOGAN ENTERPRISES LLC
text: Good Concrete Company

name: Sam Hughes
text: Driving in Nashville Tennessee and one of their trucks cut me off in traffic and almost ran me off the road and sped up to get away from me before I could get a picture. Unprofessional drivers usually leads to unprofessional work in my experience.

name: Brent Keapproth
text: I'm a subcontractor and work for Joey of Blaylock. Im in Florida so they cover a lot of territory. Good people to work for. They pay their bills!

name: Damna919
text: Id like to talk to someone about why my counter tops are cracked all over. I have more photos. Pretty upset at the moment, I would like to think someone would have notified me before you "finished" the job. What do I do about this? We came home after your team came out to find bags not left on the curb and trash in random places in the garage. Also, Mold growing on cabinets you left in my garage and beams. Confused on what you guys actually did.

name: nandee castaneda
text: Great company to work for. Friendly employees

name: Johnathan Mcneil
text: Great construction company. Excellent Craftsman ship. Hard working group of guys.
